bibl.title: James McGarth and William Herbert vs King County. Order Granting Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District SS
In the District Court holding terms at Seattle in King County
In the Matter of the Application of James McGrath and William Herbert Order Granting Writ For a Writ of Habeas Corpus
div1.p: Upon reading and filing the petition of James McGarth and William Herbert, duly signed and verified by them, whereby it appears that they are illegeally imprisioned and restrained of their liberty by L.V. Wycroff Sheriff of the COunty of King and Keeper of the County Jail of said King County, at Seattle in the County of King in the Territory of Washington, and stating wherein the allegded illegality consists from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue.

It is rendered that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court for the 3rd Judicial District Of Washington Territory tolding terms at Seattle in King County directed to the said L.V. Wycroff sheriff and keeper as
aforesaid, commanding him to have the bodies of the said James McGarth and William Herbert before me in my chambers in said Seattle on the 22nd day of March AD 1880 as 2 10 o'clock p a.m. of that day to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said James McGarth and William Herber, together with the time and cause of their detentention and have then and there the said writ.
div1.ab: No. 2411 Matter of the Application of James McGarth and William Herbert For a Writ of Habeas Corpus Order Granting Writ Filed March 20th 1880 James Satev, Clerk By James P Ludlow Deputy Clerk Hall and Osborne Attys for Complaintants
